==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|て|め|yomi=kun}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=てめ|手|tr1=te|t1=hand|目|tr2=me|t2=eye|pos2=in reference to the “eyes” or dots on [[dice]] used for gambling}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|てめ|y=kun}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|てめ}}

# [[cheat#Verb|cheating]] or [[deceive|deceiving]] to favor oneself at [[gambling]] or some other activity, such as by making sure the [[dice]] roll a certain way, or by [[rig]]ging a [[deal]] of cards
# such a cheat or [[deception]]
# [[plot#Verb|plotting]] to [[undertake]] a [[crime]] or [[prank]]
# the [[scheme]] or [[plan]] for such a crime or prank

====Idiom====
* {{ja-r|手目を上げる|てめ を あげる}}: “to raise up [an instance of] cheating” → to [[see through]] and [[point out]] [[proof]] of a trick or deception
